p:
The model accurately estimates CO 2 sequestration and soil N 2O emissions under recent N deposition rates. For tropical forests, the total biomass C equilibrium of the model is 124 Mg C ha −1 (see Supplementary Note 1 for equilibria analysis), which is similar to Batterman et al.
3 , which reported 128 Mg C ha −1 in old growth tropical forests. For temperate forests, the total biomass C equilibrium of the model is 145 Mg C ha −1, which is similar to Pregitzer et al.
56 , which reported 171 Mg C ha −1 in old growth temperate forests. For boreal forests, the total biomass C equilibrium of the model is 75 Mg C ha −1, which is similar to Pregitzer et al.
56 , which reported 81 Mg C ha −1 in old growth boreal forests.
